comments.author: LAURELAI\admin
comments.text:
✅ IMPLEMENTATION COMPLETE

## Summary
Successfully implemented per-account preferences with full support for account-specific overrides of global settings.

## Changes Made

### 1. AccountPreferences Structure (app_state.rs:59-126)
Created a new struct with Optional fields for all overridable preferences:
- color_mode, language_prefs, show_content_warnings
- auto_play_gifs, auto_play_videos, reduce_motion
- font_size, haptic_feedback, sound_effects
- pinned_feeds, muted_words (account-specific)

### 2. Per-Account Storage (app_state.rs:212)
Added to AppPersistedState:
`account_preferences: HashMap<String, AccountPreferences>`
Keyed by account DID for isolated per-account state

### 3. Preference Resolution Methods (app_state.rs:273-370)
Implemented getter methods with automatic fallback:
- `get_*_for_account(did: Option<&str>)` for each preference
- Returns account override if set, otherwise returns global
- Passing None always returns global preference

### 4. Preference Setter Methods (app_state.rs:374-476)
Implemented setters for per-account overrides:
- `set_account_*(did, value: Option<T>)` methods
- Setting to None clears override (uses global)
- Automatic cleanup of empty preference entries

### 5. Utility Methods
- `has_account_overrides(did)` - check if account has any overrides
- `clear_account_preferences(did)` - remove all overrides for account
- `cleanup_account_prefs_if_empty(did)` - automatic cleanup

## Testing
- ✅ **16 new unit tests** added
- ✅ **23 total app_state tests** passing
- ✅ **78 workspace tests** passing
- ✅ Full workspace builds successfully
- ✅ Tested resolution with/without overrides
- ✅ Tested serialization/deserialization
- ✅ Tested automatic cleanup
- ✅ Tested multiple accounts with different preferences

## Use Cases Supported
- ✅ Different theme per account (work = light, personal = dark)
- ✅ Different language per account
- ✅ Different content filters per account
- ✅ Account-specific pinned feeds
- ✅ Account-specific muted words
- ✅ Any preference can be overridden per-account

## Example Usage
```rust
let mut state = AppPersistedState::default();

// Set global preferences
state.color_mode = ColorMode::Light;
state.font_size = 1.0;

// Override for work account
state.set_account_color_mode("did:plc:work", Some(ColorMode::Dark));
state.set_account_font_size("did:plc:work", Some(1.2));

// Resolution with fallback
assert_eq!(state.get_color_mode_for_account(Some("did:plc:work")), ColorMode::Dark);
assert_eq!(state.get_color_mode_for_account(Some("did:plc:personal")), ColorMode::Light);
assert_eq!(state.get_color_mode_for_account(None), ColorMode::Light);

// Clear override
state.set_account_color_mode("did:plc:work", None);
// Now uses global again
```

Next: UI layer to expose per-account preferences in Settings screen.

comments.author: LAURELAI\admin
comments.text:
✅ IMPLEMENTATION COMPLETE

## Summary
Successfully implemented custom AppView selector per user. Each account can now configure their own AppView endpoint independently.

## Changes Made

### 1. Data Model (atproto-client/src/session/mod.rs)
- Added `app_view_url: Option<String>` field to SessionAccount struct
- Updated all constructors and serialization
- Defaults to None (uses service URL)

### 2. Session Management (atproto-client/src/session/manager.rs)
- Modified `switch_account()` to configure BskyAgent with account's AppView URL
- Added `set_account_app_view(did, url)` method to update AppView for an account
- Added `get_account_app_view(did)` method to retrieve current AppView setting
- Agent automatically recreates when AppView is changed for current account

### 3. Auth Service Integration (app-core/src/auth.rs)
- Added `set_app_view_url(did, url)` method (wrapper around SessionManager)
- Added `get_app_view_url(did)` method (wrapper around SessionManager)
- Provides high-level API for UI layer

## Testing
- ✅ 20 new unit tests added
- ✅ All 39 session tests passing
- ✅ All 64 storage tests passing
- ✅ Full workspace builds successfully
- ✅ Tested serialization with/without AppView URL
- ✅ Tested persistence across restarts
- ✅ Tested account switching with custom AppView
- ✅ Tested error handling for nonexistent accounts

## Key Features
- Per-user AppView configuration (not global)
- Persisted to disk (survives app restarts)
- Backward compatible (None = use service URL)
- Agent recreation when AppView changes for active account
- Full error handling and validation

## Example Usage
```rust
// Set custom AppView for an account
auth_service.set_app_view_url("did:plc:abc123", Some("https://api.bsky.app".to_string())).await?;

// Get current AppView
let app_view = auth_service.get_app_view_url("did:plc:abc123").await;

// Clear custom AppView (revert to service URL)
auth_service.set_app_view_url("did:plc:abc123", None).await?;
```

comments.author: LAURELAI\admin
comments.text:
✅ COMPLETED - Lexicon core data structures implemented

## Implementation Summary

Created comprehensive Lexicon schema system with 4 modules:

### 1. formats.rs (11 string formats)
- AtIdentifier, AtUri, Cid, Datetime, Did, Handle, Nsid, Tid, RecordKey, Uri, Language
- Full serde support with kebab-case serialization
- 5 unit tests passing

### 2. constraints.rs (6 constraint types)  
- StringConstraints (maxLength, minLength, maxGraphemes, enum, const, default)
- IntegerConstraints (maximum, minimum, enum, const, default)
- BooleanConstraints, ArrayConstraints, BlobConstraints, BytesConstraints
- 6 unit tests passing

### 3. types.rs (13 primitive types)
- LexString, LexInteger, LexBoolean, LexBytes, LexCidLink, LexBlob
- LexArray, LexObject, LexToken, LexUnion, LexUnknown, LexRefType
- LexRef for reference resolution
- 5 unit tests passing

### 4. schema.rs (top-level structures)
- LexiconDoc (top-level document with lexicon version, id, defs)
- LexiconDef enum (Record, Query, Procedure, Subscription + all primitive types)
- LexRecord, LexQuery, LexProcedure, LexSubscription, LexParams, LexBody
- RecordKeyType (Tid | Any), LexXrpcError
- 9 unit tests passing

- Total: 117 tests passing (87 unit + 17 integration + 13 doc)
- Lexicon tests: 25 passing
